title: 3million motorists illegally on the road with an out of date driving licence
text:

Millions of drivers could be on the road illegally - because they're unaware their licence has expired, figures show.

An estimated three million motorists are said to be breaking the law over confusion around how often their licence must be renewed.

That's according to a report by the Post Office which also warned that the penalty fine of driving with an expired document is £1,000.

Over two-fifths of UK drivers don’t know their driving licences must be renewed every 10 years, it said.

This confusion extends to nearly one-third not realising it is a necessary and legal requirement for licences to be updated following a name change or change of address.

Without checking, over half don’t know when their driving licence expires, and, upon checking, one in ten people surveyed found theirs was out of date.

(Image: Photographer's Choice RF)

With over 33 million driving licences in the UK, this means almost three million people possess an out-of-date licence, of which there are serious repercussions.

Not only do people need their driving licence to legally drive, but the research revealed over four in five people use it as a primary form of identification.

This is led by the younger generation, with 16-24 year-olds using their licence to prove their identity on average eight times per month.

Martin Edwards, at the Post Office said: "When it comes to renewing their driving licence, so many people are nervous about getting it wrong, and having to repeat the process.

"This has implications not only for driving legally, with the majority of people using their driving licence as their primary source of ID for a range of everyday products and services.

"It is quick and easy for customers to renew their driving licence at the Post Office, ensuring they can continue to drive legally and prove their identity to access services."

description: More than two-fifths of UK drivers are unaware that driving licences must be renewed every 10 years - and the penalty for it is eye-watering
